quizzes.question: The properties regarding table borders are:
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]The Table Properties[/h1] The look of an HTML table can be greatly improved with CSS. The [b]border-collapse[/b] property specifies whether the table borders are collapsed into a single border or separated as default. If the borders are separate, the [b]border-spacing[/b] property can be used to change the spacing. [b]The HTML:[/b][code format="html" ]
Red Green
Blue Yellow
[/code] [b]The CSS:[/b][code format="css" codeId="556"]table { [b] border-collapse:[/b] separate; [b]border-spacing:[/b] 20px 40px; }[/code] [b]Result:[/b] [img id="2637" width="100%"]

[h1]The caption-side Property[/h1] The [b]caption-side[/b] property specifies the position of a table caption. The values can be set as [b]top[/b] or [b]bottom[/b]. In the example below, we specify the placement of a table caption to [b]top[/b]. [b]The HTML:[/b][code format="html" ]
Some of Our Courses
Course name Lessons Quizzes
C++ 81 363
JavaScript 48 144
HTML 38 119
CSS 70 174
[/code] [b]The CSS:[/b][code format="css" codeId="557"]caption { [b]caption-side[/b]: top; }[/code] [b]Result:[/b] [img id="2638" width="100%"]

[h1]The empty-cells Property [/h1] The [b]empty-cells[/b] property specifies whether or not to display borders and background on empty cells in a table. Possible values are: [b]show[/b]: the borders of an empty cell are rendered [b]hide[/b]: the borders of an empty cell are not drawn Here is the empty-cells property that is used to hide borders of empty cells in the element. [b]The HTML:[/b][code format="html" ]
HTML CSS
JavaScript
[/code] [b]The CSS:[/b][code format="css" codeId="558"]table { border-collapse: separate; [b]empty-cells: hide;[/b] }[/code] [b]Result:[/b] [img id="2639" width="100%"]
